typedef void(* log_callback_ft )(char *)
 Callback definition to print log messages. The argument is the message to print.
typedef void(* chat_callback_ft )(char *)
 Callback definition for receiving chat messages. The argument is the received chat message.
typedef void(* status_callback_ft )(teteco_status_t)
 Callback definition to notifty status changes.
typedef void(* file_transfer_callback_ft )(const char *, teteco_file_transfer_status_t, uint32_t, uint32_t)
 Callback definition to notify file transfer events. First argument is filename, sencond file transfer status. Third total size of file in bytes. Fourth the number of bytes sent/received.

Detailed Description

This library provides a communication stack for simplex VoIP communications. It's intended for very asimetric Internet links where a duplex VoIP communication could cause problems flooding the upload link. Additionally libteteco provides file transfer functionality with bandwidth control management. libteteco also takes care of sound device management.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum log_levet_t

Level of log messages.

Enumerator:
LOG_DEBUG 

Display all logmessages.

enum teteco_audio_mode_t

Describes if the client is going to receive or send audio/files.

Enumerator:
TETECO_AUDIO_RECEIVER 

Receiver mode.

TETECO_AUDIO_SENDER 

Sender mode.

TETECO_AUDIO_UNDEFINED 

Undefined mode.

enum teteco_file_transfer_status_t

Describes the file transfer status.

Enumerator:
TETECO_FILE_TRANSFER_RECEIVING 

Is sending a file.

TETECO_FILE_TRANSFER_END 

Is receiving a file.

File transfer has finished (because all data has been tranferred or an error occurred).

enum teteco_net_mode_t

Defines how the network mode.

Enumerator:
TETECO_NET_CLIENT 

Server mode: will wait for incoming connections.

Client mode: will try to connect to a server

enum teteco_speex_band_t

Represent the 3 different Speex Modes.

Enumerator:
TETECO_SPEEX_WB 

Speex WideBand.

TETECO_SPEEX_NB 

Speex NarrowBand.

TETECO_SPEEX_UWB 

Speex UltraWideBand.

enum teteco_status_t

Describes the status of the teteco_t struct.

Enumerator:
TETECO_STATUS_DISCONNECTED 

Disconnected.

TETECO_STATUS_CONNECTING 

Trying to connect (only in client mode).

TETECO_STATUS_WAITING 

Waiting for a connection (only in server mode).

TETECO_STATUS_CONNECTED 

Connected.

TETECO_STATUS_TIMEDOUT 

When no communication from peer host has been received for a long time.

const char *  comment 
)

Sends a chat message

Used to send chat messages to the other peer

Precondition:
teteco struct is initialized and status is connected
Postcondition:
the message is sent
Parameters:
teteco A initialized teteco_t struct
comment A terminated string
Returns:
1 if message was sent. 0 in other case

int teteco_get_in_devices ( int **  index,
char ***  devices 
)

Return a list of the available audio recording devices

This function should be called to obtain a list of all available recording devices and their index. Default device is always returned in first position

Precondition:
library is initialized
Postcondition:
index and devices params are populated. Those should be freeded by the caller.
Parameters:
index Where indexes are returned. Pass a &int* variable pointing to NULL;
device Where device names are returned. Pass a &char** pointing to NULL;
Returns:
The number of devices (whichs maps with the arrays length returned in parameter)

teteco_t* teteco_start ( teteco_net_mode_t  client_or_server,
uint16_t  local_port,
uint16_t  remote_port,
const char *  remote_address,
int  audio_device_in,
int  audio_device_out,
teteco_audio_mode_t  audio_mode,
teteco_speex_band_t  enc_speex_band,
int  enc_quality,
const char *  user_directory 
)

Initilize a teteco_t strcut to be used for communication

This is the first function to be called when starting a communication. Its parameters will define how the stack will behabe

Precondition:
library is initialized
Postcondition:
Audio, codec, stack and net is ready to starts a session
Parameters:
teteco_net_mode_t Defines is the client will connect or wait for a connection
local_port Defines the local UDP port (1-65536) to be used for communication. Set 0 for any.
remote_port Defines the UDP port to connect. Only used in client mode. Set 0 in server mode.
remote_address Defines the full qualified domain name or IP to connect. Only in client mode. Set to NULL in server mode.
audio_device_in Defines the index of audio device to use for sound recording. Only used in SENDER mode.
audio_device_out Defines the index of audio device to use for sound playing. Only used in RECEIVER mode.
audio_mode Defines if it will act as audio SENDER o RECEIVER.
enc_speex_band Defines the SPEEX mode to use (NB, WB or UWB).
enc_quality Defines the SPEEX quality to use (from 0 to 10);
user_directory Defines where received files will be saved.
Returns:
A initialized teteco_t struct is all was properly initialized. NULL in an error occurred.
teteco_t* teteco_stop ( teteco_t *  teteco  ) 

Stop a communication session

Notifies other peer to stop communication and free teteco_t struct resources

Precondition:
teteco struct is initialized
Postcondition:
communication is finished and teteco_t struct is freeded
Parameters:
teteco A initialized teteco_t struct
Returns:
NULL in any case.
